features: ORGANIC COCONUT MILK POWDER DRINK MIX: Chockfull of vitamins, minerals, electrolytes, and medium-chain fatty acids, our Coconut Milk Powder is great for those looking for a sweet, creamy treat with a convenient boost of wellness.

RICH IN ORGANIC VIRGIN COCONUT OIL & FATTY ACIDS: Made with 65 percent virgin coconut oil, our Coconut Milk Powder is a powerhouse of medium-chain fatty acids (lauric, caprylic, and capric acids), which promote balance, well-being, & vitality.
PURE, PLANT-BASED POWER: Vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free, and sugar-free with no fillers and 100 percent certified organic to suit a range of dietary restrictions.

A VARIETY OF WAYS TO INDULGE, GUILT-FREE: Enjoy our Coconut Milk Powder on its own, use it as a healthy non-dairy creamer, blend it into smoothies, or incorporate it into a variety of recipes and other beverages.

ENERHEALTH TIP: For an extra health boost, blend this Coconut Milk Powder with our Enerfood Powder to create a super healthy, decadent smoothie. Add it to our Coco Mojo for a nutritious and incredibly decadent hot chocolate!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Eating a healthy diet can be challenging in a fast-paced world with hectic schedules. That’s why we created Enerfood, a synergistic blend of 20 organic superfoods rich in chlorophyll, A & B vitamins (including B-12), antioxidants, bioflavonoids, iron, and trace minerals. This nutrient-dense, alkalizing formula is a holistic wellness booster that supports your body’s detoxification process, provides balanced energy levels, and promotes peak performance. What’s more, it’s a breeze to incorporate Enerfood into a busy lifestyle. Simply mix one tablespoon with juice or incorporate it into your favorite smoothie. For a decadently delicious and healthy smoothie, blend Enerfood with our Organic Coconut Milk Powder, along with some strawberries, apple juice, and water. Whether you're a vegan, vegetarian, athlete, a busy parent, or a student seeking increased energy, mental clarity, focus, and overall well-being, this powdered drink mix offers a convenient way to live a healthy lifestyle. It is particularly beneficial for individuals who may not have the time or means for a strict diet or regular exercise.

20 organic Superfoods Coconut has long been celebrated for its impressive nutritional profile and health benefits. Here are some of the key advantages of incorporating coconut milk into your diet: Rich in Medium-Chain Fatty Acids: Coconut milk is abundant in medium-chain triglycerides (MCTs), particularly lauric acid, caprylic acid, and capric acid. These MCTs are known for their ability to provide quick and sustained energy. Because of this rapid conversion and utilization, MCTs are often used by individuals following ketogenic diets.Supports Digestion: The healthy fats in coconut milk can aid in absorption of fat-soluble vitamins and nutrients. Additionally, medium-chain fatty acids may have a positive impact on gut health by contributing to the balance of microbiome.Immune System Support: Lauric acid, a substantial component of coconut milk, contributes to the strengthening of the immune system by fortifying its defenses.

In 2005, Steve St. Clair founded EnerHealth Botanicals with a vision to promote conscious wellness for the mind, body, and soul. Through our innovative Spagyric whole plant extraction process and a diverse product line, we offer organic products designed to support a holistic approach to wellness. Our diverse product line features an array of wellness-boosting options, including herbal extracts, salves, and sprays. We also offer NutriCafé, our signature blend of whole bean organic coffee infused with medicinal mushrooms, as well as Cocoa Mojo, a rich and delicious organic cocoa blend containing medicinal mushroom extracts and coconut palm sugar. For those seeking nutrient-dense green superfoods, our Enerfood is an excellent choice. Additionally, we carry Coconut Milk Powder and a range of other exceptional products to support your overall well-being.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Purist powdered coconut milk I've found
reviews.reviewText: Awesome product. Many people read the front label and mistakenly think there is only 65% coconut in this product. There is actually 99.5% coconut with 65% of that coming from virgin coconut oil. Only 0.5% is emulsifiers. This is absolutely the best percentages I've found in any powdered coconut milk - although there might be one I've missed. It has a rich, creamy taste - probably due to the high percentage of coconut oil. Because of the high oil content, I can get my daily coconut oil even if I'm not cooking anything requiring oil (or when traveling) just by adding this to other dishes or drinks. I even add it to the pot when cooking rice.As with all powdered coconut milk, it tends to lump when mixed in cold liquids (haven't tried hot). And this is unsweetened which some may dislike because they are used to other powdered coconut milk products which have a lot of added sweeteners and sugars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Delicious, creamy and healthy!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great way to get your coconut oil without having to put actual oil in everything (like coffee!). It is 65% coconut oil! I mix up a super-concentrated batch of this and use it as creamer in coffee. It's delicious. I also put it in soups, anything hot and liquid will work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent as a coffee creamer
reviews.reviewText: I bought this specifically as a coffee creamer. It has a great lightly sweet flavor which allows me to add less sugar in my coffee.I recently tried a different brand of dried coconut milk and did not like it nearly as well as this one. The other brand had too much of an oily texture for my taste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Tastes great, but made me sick.
reviews.reviewText: Gave me a stomach ache and diarrhea

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars falls short of 5 stars
reviews.reviewText: Normally I don't write a review unless I am rating an item at 5 stars, but in this case,I cannot give it 5 stars but will comment anyway.I was hoping this powder would mix with water to make a coconut milk similar to that which i get at the grocery store in a carton. Sadly no. It is just 65% coconut oil that has been somehow powderized. Using the recomended 2 heaping tablespoons in water gets nowhere even close to carton coconut milk in taste and texture.Also as others have noted here this product contains dairy derived contents; so if you are using it to avoid dairy this is not your best choice.One good thing about it is that it can be easily added to a protien powder to include some healthy lipid content.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great stuff, but pricey
reviews.reviewText: Pros:+Tastes great and a healthy form of good fats+Powder form great for travelCons:-Difficult to fully mix or dissolve in liquids without a blender or whisk-Pricey!This product is great if your recipes ask for coconut milk in powder form, otherwise you can get coconut milk for a fraction of the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2014
reviews.reviewText: This powder doesn't have much flavor and doesn't mix easily enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's GREAT. Thanks
reviews.reviewText: If I had a complaint about this it would be that I have to work a bit to get it to dissolve...but it is worth it. It's GREAT. Thanks. Amazon.
